Japan's Ambition to Grab Tok Islet Flayed 
    Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Solidarity of Youth and Students for Implementing the June 15 South-North Joint Declaration reportedly made public a statement on Mar. 31 slamming the balderdash let loose by a minister of the Japanese embassy in Washington.
 The statement referred to the fact that the Japanese minister in his article contributed to the Washington Post insisted that Tok Islet belongs to Japan. Such an outcry made at a time when the resentment of all the people has reached at its height due to the issue of the islet clearly proves that Japan's scheme to revive militarism is being put into a concrete shape, it noted.    
 Accusing Japan of more undisguisedly laying bare its ambition to seize Tok Islet, the statement demanded Japan give up its foolish daydream of "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere" and behave with discretion.

San Marino and DPRK to Cooperate with Each Other 
    Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Giuseppe Arzilli, captain-regent of the Republic of San Marino, stressed the need for San Marino and the DPRK to cooperate with each other in the international arena under the present complicated international situation and ardently hoped that the situation on the Korean Peninsula would be stable and the Korean people would live in peace in a reunified country.
 DPRK Ambassador to San Marino Choe Thaek San presented his credentials to Captains-Regent Giuseppe Arzilli and Marino Raschi on Mar. 31.    
 At the meeting Giuseppe Arzilli said the establishment of diplomatic ties between San Marino and the DPRK is in full line with the interests of the two peoples. It will be conducive to world peace and development to actively develop the bilateral relations in diverse fields including politics, economy and culture, he added.

DPRK Delegation Returns Home
    Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The DPRK delegation headed by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, returned home today after visiting African countries.
 The delegation was greeted at the airport by Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, officials concerned and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe.
